intro: Ecbolium chapadanum, commonly known as the Chapadana thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant is characterized by its spiny, glandular leaves and yellow flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Ecbolium chapadanum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain insects and birds.
